Description: Copper alloy buckle consists of a narrow oval loop, a tongue with a basal cube inlaid with quincunx of blue and green glass disc and a rectangular plate with folded flap attachment and raised central panel with an all-over cloisonné red, blue and green glass inlays. Two out of three peripheral rivets remain.
Curator's comments: Comment from Kidd, Haith & Ager ‘Summary Catalogue’ (draft MS) Published: SMITH R.A. 1923. A Guide to the Anglo-Saxon and Foreign Teutonic Antiquities in the Department of British and Mediaeval Antiquities. London, p. 153 MONNERET de VILLARD U. 1934. Oreficeria Barbarica in Africa, Memorie Storiche Foro Giuliesi XXX, Udine, p. 219 BIERBRAUER V. 1975. Die Ostgotischen Grab- und Schatzfunde in Italien, Centro Italiano di Studi sull'Alto Medioevo, Studi Mediaevali VII. Spoleto, p. 157 note 217 (wrong registration no.), pl. LXXXI:3 (wrong provenance)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
